result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew J. Orsted was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Non-Narcotics, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay $250 fine plus costs. If paid in full within 60 days, jail time will be stayed. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol. Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.
Obtain AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.

timeConds.notes: Stayed if Defendant pays all fine and costs within 60 days.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew J. Orsted

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Andrew J. Orsted in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters guilty plea to Count 1. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty of Count 1. Count 2 is dismissed but read in for sentencing. Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. State/Defense make sentencing recommendations. Bond no longer in effect.

Defense waives reading of Information, enters not guilty pleas, advises of offer that requires payment up front. Status conference set for November 16, 2015, 10:00. If plea, Defendant must be here in person. Bond continues as is.

Defendant Andrew J. Orsted appeared by phone. Attorney Gregory A. Gerbers appeared in Court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that Defendant will waive prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds Defendant over for trial.

Defendant Andrew J. Orsted appeared by phone. Attorney Gregory A. Gerbers appeared in Court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is at orientation for new job. Defense requests that waiver of prelim be scheduled within next 30 days. Defendant can appear by phone for next hearing.  Waiver of Prelim scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Additional Request for Electronic Discovery for Door County Cases
Application, Affidavit, Application for Search Warrant, Acknowledgment of Return of Officer

Defendant Andrew J. Orsted in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim. Defense advises that Defendant will waive time limits for prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver. Defense requests status.  Status conference scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed. Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia. To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving Justice Center. Signature bond converts to a $500 cash bond at 4:30 pm on Friday, 6/26/15. If not paid by then, Defendant to report to the jail.

Defendant Andrew J. Orsted appeared by video conference. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 7/6/15, 10:00.
